paper_support: Thin board, possibly paper faced; reverse is painted black. Support is sound. The top layer, possibly paper has small losses in lower corners and along lower edge. Small losses from rabbet abrasion have been toned out.
title: Curtius Jumping into the Roman Forum
description: Small oil on board, very dark in color.
inscriptions:
Inscription "Martin A.D. 1837" on paper label. Colourman stamp on reverse with handwritten ink.
Inscription at top: Martins "Curtius Jumping into the Gulp." The label is bordered and includes the following: "Flemish Ground Milled Boards, prepared by ROWNEY & FORSTER, Artists' Colourmen, 51 Rathbone Place, London."
